title.rendered: ICC Women’s World Cup 2017: Deepti Sharma new all rounder sensation in Indian Women’s Cricket

content.rendered:
19-year-old Deepti Sharma from Agra in the talks these days for tremendous performance in the ICC women world cup.The all-around performance of young talent was witnessed in the crucial semi final against Australia where she was a pick of the bowlers and her confidence was evident after she took a brilliant catch to dismiss Nicole Bolton, She paired crucial 4th wkt Partnership: 104 off 72 balls with Harman Kaur (77) and made 24 runs. 19-year-old Deepti also is Team India’s highest wicket taker, having claimed 12 wickets in the 8 matches and sits fourth behind South African duo Niekerk, Marizanne Kapp and Australian Kristen Beams in the standings for most number of wickets in the 2017 ICC Women’s World Cup.

Not many of us aware that she is a great fan of Suresh Raina and admitted that she wants to master Raina’s special ‘inside-out’ shot. In ICC Women’s World Cup she is shining because of her bowling performance but in the world cup Qualifiers, she was the leading run-scorer for the tournament, scoring 253 runs in 6 match with a highest of 89. She also set a world record for opening partnership of 320 runs with Poonam Raut contributing.This beat both the standing women’s record of 229 (by Sarah Taylor and Caroline Atkins of England) and the standing men’s record in ODIs of 286 (by Upul Tharanga and Sanath Jayasuriya of Sri Lanka).

As of June she has played 20 one day International matches and scored 737 runs at an avg of 52.64. All the eyes are set on her and team India for the final match going on today against England and the latest update is India needs 63 runs off 66 balls with 7 wickets remaining.

excerpt.rendered: 19-year-old Deepti Sharma from Agra in the talks these days for tremendous performance in the ICC women world cup.The all-around performance of young talent was witnessed in the crucial semi final against Australia where she was a pick of the bowlers and her confidence was evident after she took a brilliant catch to dismiss Nicole […]

better_featured_image.alt_text: ICC Women's World Cup 2017, Deepti sharma , india cricket team, women world cup , cricket , new sensation, deepti sharma cricket, Deepti Sharma women crickter, sports

jetpack-related-posts.title: ICC Women's World Cup 2017: India reaches finals as Harmanpreet Kaur squalls over Australia
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: It was completely Harmanpreet Kaur's show as India reaches the finals of the ICC Women's World Cup for the second time by defeating six-times champions Australia in the second semi final of the tournament. Harmanpreet completely thrashed Australia by scoring over 60% of runs of entire Indian innings singlehandedly. Harmanpreet…

jetpack-related-posts.title: ICC Woman's World Cup 2017: India continues winning streak by crushing Pakistan
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: India continued their winning streak in ODI's as they crushed Pakistan by 95 run in their third match of the ICC Woman's World Cup 2017. It was India's 17th consecutive ODI win. Indian Spinner Ekta Bisht took 5 wickets in the match while giving away just 18 runs in her…

jetpack-related-posts.title: ICC Woman's World Cup 2017: India is in do-or-die situation against New Zealand
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: The Indian team is in a do-or-die situation against New Zealand in their last match in the group stage at the ICC Woman's World Cup 2017 after losing their last two matches. Seething in pain, the Indians need redemption via a convincing victory against New Zealand on Saturday to seal…

title.rendered: India vs England Women’s World Cup Final full highlights : Shrubsole kills ‘nervous 6’ to claim title for England defeating India

content.rendered:
England won the game of nerves to put Indian hopes in the ground in ICC Women’s World Cup Final, after a spirited fight back from India put them within hitting distance of the much coveted trophy. However, a late assault from Anya Shrubsole got her 6 wickets and caused a collapse of the Indian lower order, leaving the Indian chase short by 9 runs.

India lose three wickets in the space of 4 runs to lose the World Cup, and England are the champions for the first time since 2009, and fourth overall.

Shrubsole to Rajeshwari Gayakwad, out Bowled!! Rajeshwari Gayakwad b Shrubsole 0(1). This is the end of the Indian innings. Unlikely collapse, and England have won by 9 runs. This is heartbreaking for the Indian women, as they seemed ahead not three overs ago.

Shrubsole to Deepti Sharma, out Caught by Sciver!! Mistimes a length delivery and strigh to Sciver. India are on thin ice here. Deepti Sharma c Sciver b Shrubsole 14(12). Rajeshwari Gayakwad out to bat. 

Just three off the over. 11 needed off two overs with only two wickets left. Both teams have an equal chance here.

Gunn to Shikha Pandey, out Shikha Pandey Run Out!! The umpires go upstairs for this but the timing of the dismissal have really made the final dramatic. Shikha Pandey run out (Shrubsole/Taylor) 4(8). Poonam Yadav is out to bat. 

It is raining here, but India are ahead on DLS if that has anyone worried.

IND : 215/7, 47.0 overs; India Need 14 Off 18 Balls, Deepti Sharma Survives Stumping Appeal

Seven runs off the over, making it 14 off the last 18 balls. Jenny Gunn is back into the attack.

Shrubsole to Deepti Sharma, wide, there is a stumping appeal. The bails seem to come off a bit late even though the stumps moved. The umpire has taken the call in India’s favour, this is a massive decision in India’s favour as a wicket now would have meant certain defeat. Sharma will live another day.

Seven off the over. Shrubsole back into the attack.

Alex Hartley to Deepti Sharma, FOUR, a straight loft over the bowler. This match still may either way.

IND : 201/7, 45.0 overs; India Need 28 Off 30 Balls As Match Heads To Tense Finish

Three runs and two wickets off the over. Shikha Pandey comes to bat. Hartley will bowl the next over.

Shrubsole to Goswami, out Bowled!! Cleaned up. Balls manages to screw in under the bat and castle the stumps. It is not looking good for India here. Goswami b Shrubsole 0(1). Shikha Pandey walks onto the crease.

Shrubsole to Veda Krishnamurthy, out Caught by Sciver!!This is a big setback for India as the hitter is sent home and the tail is being exposed. This may be the end for India. Veda Krishnamurthy c Sciver b Shrubsole 35(34). Jhulan Goswami comes out to bat. 

Seven runs off the over. Shrubsole back into the attack.

Alex Hartley to Sushma Verma, out Bowled!! She tries to sweep off the flat of her bat, but instead drags it to the stumps. Not a great shot to try off the second ball, all she needed to do was support Krishnamurthy who is batting so well here. Sushma goes for a duck. Sushma Verma b Alex Hartley 0(2). Deepti Sharma is the new bat. 

Alex Hartley to Veda Krishnamurthy, FOUR, Krishnamurthy steps out her crease and puts it over cover. She is driving the innings here.

Nine runs and a wicket off the over. Hartley will bowl the next over.

Shrubsole to Punam Raut, out Lbw!! In-cutter beats Raut’s defence and hit s her on the pads, right in front of the middle stump. The review did not help and Raut’s got to go. She misses a well deserved century here and India seem to be in just a little bit of trouble here. Punam Raut lbw b Shrubsole 86(115). Sushma Verma walks in to bat.

Shrubsole to Veda Krishnamurthy, FOUR, this was an aggressive shot from Krishnamurthy who is threatening to end it very soon.

Shrubsole to Veda Krishnamurthy, FOUR, Krishnamurthy puts away the wide one over point and the Lord’s slope does the rest.

Four runs, all singles off the over. Shrubsole is now into the attack.

Five runs off the over. Alex Hartley to start her last spell now.

Marsh to bowl the 41st over.

IND : 173/3, 40.0 overs; India Need 56 Runs Off 60 Balls

Seven runs off the over, Raut looks fine now. India need 56 runs off 60 balls.

Only one run off this over. Jenny Gunn will bowl the 40th over. Punam Raut is down with cramps, and she has three people attending to her. India need Raut to finish this off.

Four runs off the over, Marsh back on the other end.

Gunn to Veda Krishnamurthy, no run, dropped. Knight is the fielder here, the England skipper may have just dropped the World Cup here. She had both hands on the short cover shot, but couldn’t hold on to it.

Six runs off the over, Jenny Gunn comes back into the attack.

Marsh to Punam Raut, FOUR, Raut pushes the short and wide delivery to the boundary. England seem to be losing track here.

Ten off the over. Marsh is back into the attack.

Alex Hartley to Veda Krishnamurthy, FOUR, she drives on the front foot and the fast outfield and powerplay restrictions mean that it is a four.

Alex Hartley is back into the attack.

IND : 145/3, 35.0 overs; India Need 84 Off 90 Balls 

Seven runs off the over. 84 needed off 90 balls now.

Marsh to Punam Raut, no run, but keeper Sarah Taylor misses a stumping here.

Marsh to Veda Krishnamurthy, FOUR, hit right over Marsh’s head. Krishnamurthy was out of her crease and lofted it right up.

Two runs and a wicket off the over. Laura Marsh is back into the attack.

Alex Hartley to Harmanpreet Kaur, out Caught by Beaumont!! Kaur swept the fullish ball stright to the deep backward square leg fielder, a soft ending to a great innings. India lose a wicket just when they were looking set on the match. England may still have a chance. Harmanpreet Kaur c Beaumont b Alex Hartley 51(80). Veda Krishnamurthy is the new bat.

Three runs off the over, Hartley is back into the attack.

Brunt to Harmanpreet Kaur, and a glance over fine leg brings up her half century. If India go on to win the World Cup, Kaur’s role will be immortalised.

Six off the last over. Brunt is back into the attack.

Alex Hartley to Punam Raut, FOUR, walks down the track and put it over infield over the extra covers. Raut is on song here.

Seven runs off the over. Alex Hartley is back into the attack.

Brunt is going back into the attack. India need 109 runs off 120 balls, with a powerplay to go. India look within hitting distance of the title here.

IND : 120/2, 30.0 overs; India Step On The Runrate

Six runs off the over, India seem to have found their two saviours in Kaur and Raut. The run rate now stands at 4 per over. Single off the last ball brought up Raut’s half century.

Six runs off the over, Shrubsole back into the attack.

Sciver to Harmanpreet Kaur, FOUR, this was a  slow ball from Sciver but it took some bat from Kaur, not so pretty but India will take it at this point.

Two runs off the over. Sciver back into the attack.

Seven runs off the over, and Shrubsole is back into the attack. England are looking to break the partnership here.

Sciver to Harmanpreet Kaur, FOUR, this was a short one from Sciver and a pull from Kaur sent it on its way behind square.

Seven runs off the over, with a no-ball giving an extra ball. Sciver returns to bowl at the other end.

Knight to Raut, and she flicks it nicely behind square to bring up the 50-run stand off 78 balls.

Heather Knight is the new bowler.

IND : 92/2, 25.0 overs; Kaur-Raut Pair Lead Partial Recovery

Four runs off the over. The equation is 136 off 150 runs now.

Sciver to Punam Raut, no run, but England save a review after a long discussion for an lbw. Replay shows the ball missed the stump.

Alex Hartley to Harmanpreet Kaur, SIX, this was a slog sweep from the batter who seems to be working in sixes here. Nine runs off this over. Sciver to continue her spell.

Four runs off this over. Just singles. Hartley back into the attack.

Two runs off the over. Marsh is back into the attack.

Four singles off the over, the Indians have to keep rotating the strike like this if they want to keep the run rate in check. Hartley will bowl the next over.

IND : 69/2, 20.0 overs; India Choke Themselves On Tight England Bowling

Ten runs off the over. Marsh to bowl the next over.

Alex Hartley to Harmanpreet Kaur, SIX, hit firmly over long on, India needed this badly. Kaur used her feet well and danced down to thrash it to over the rope.

Four runs off the over, with a wide. It may be early, but the Indians seem to be choking themselves. Alex Hartley is back into the attack.

Just the one run off the 18th over. The runs have definitely dried up for the Indians and the pressure is firmly on them.

Four runs off the over, only 11 runs have come in the last 5 overs. Alex Hartley, left arm orthodox, is the new bowler.

Gunn bowls another maiden. She has incredible figures of 4-2-4-0. Marsh back into the attack.

IND : 50/2, 15.0 overs; Mithali Is Run Out In Heartbreaking Misunderstanding

Five runs off the over. Gunn will bowl the next over.

Marsh to Harmanpreet Kaur, FOUR, Kaur miscued the shot but escaped a leaping mid-on fielder. Close for Kaur at this stage.

Two runs off the over. Marsh to continue.

Wicket maiden for Marsh. Gunn will bowl the next over.

Marsh to Punam Raut, out Mithali Run Out!! Raut flicked it to mid-wicket  and set-off but Mithali was late to respond, and she fell well short of the crease. This must be heartbreaking for the Indian captain. Mithali run out (Sciver/Taylor) 17(31). Harmanpreet Kaur, last match’s hero, walks in.

Two runs off the over, Laura Marsh, right arm fast medium is into the attack.

Tens runs off the over, Gunn to continue at the other end.

Sciver to Mithali, FOUR, the Indian captain drives through cover and went past the ring of fielders.

Sciver to Punam Raut, FOUR, hit over deep mid-wicket and falls just before the boundary rope.

Sciver will bowl the 11th over.

IND : 31/1, 10.0 overs; Mithali and Raut Play Safe As Runs Become Difficult For India

Gunn bowls another tight maiden over, Mithali is not taking chances clearly.

Sciver begins with an excellent maiden. Jenny Gunn replaces Shrubsole at the other end.

Seven off the over, Natalie Sciver is the new bowler.

Shrubsole to Punam Raut, SIX, Raut is putting up a fight and what a shot this was, went straight over the long-on boundary.

Four runs off the over. Shrubsole back into the attack.

Brunt to Mithali, FOUR, yorker but Mithali made it a full toss, put past square leg.

Two runs off Shrubsole’s over. Brunt back into the attack.

IND : 18/1, 5.0 overs; Mandhana falls for duck

Five runs off the over. Shrubsole is back into the attack.

Brunt to Mithali, FOUR, excellent shot from the Indian captain. Square cut past the fielder at backward point.

Five runs off the over. Brunt back into the attack.

Shrubsole to Punam Raut, FOUR, put over the bowler’s head, much needed boundary.

Two runs off this over. Shrubsole is the next bowler.

Five runs and a wicket off the over. Brunt will bowl the next over.

Shrubsole to Mandhana, out Bowled!! This is a big wicket, the ball just went between the pad and the bat. Excellent start for England. Mandhana b Shrubsole 0(4). Mithali Raj walks in to bat.

Raut takes a single with a push to the third man. Single run off the over. Anya Shrubsole, right arm medium fast, is the new bowler.

 Punam Raut and Mandhana will open for India. Punam Raut on strike. Brunt will open the attack for the England bowling.

ENG : 228/7; India set target of 229

Seven runs off the over, and England end at 228 runs for the loss of 7 wickets. This will be a difficult but doable chase for India.

Six runs, all singles off the over. Deepti Sharma will bowl the last over.

Shikha Pandey to Marsh, FOUR, that was overpitched and easily driven through the covers by Marsh. 14 runs off the over. Gayakwad will bowl her last over.

Pandey to Gunn, no ball and a free hit that comes with it. Just a run off it though.

Shikha Pandey to Gunn, FOUR, slogged between long on and mid-wicket. Bad line from Pandey.

Five runs off the over, and England bring up their 200! Shikha Pandey will bowl the next over.

Four runs and a wicket off the over. Gayakwad back into the attack.

Shikha Pandey to Gunn, out Brunt Run Out!! Deepti Sharma gets a direct hit to the striker’s end giving no chance to Brunt who looked to settle in for the final attack. Brunt run out (Deepti Sharma) 34(42). Laura Marsh is the new bat.

Shikha Pandey is the new bowler.

ENG : 188/6, 45.0 overs; England Struggle For Runs

Four singles off Poonam Yadav’s last over, she finishes with figures of 2 for 36. This has been a good performance by Yadav.

Nine off the over. Poonam Yadav returns.

Deepti Sharma to Brunt, FOUR, Put away through cover as Poonam tosses the ball full. Much needed boundary as England look for push.

Five runs off the over. Deepti Sharma is the new bowler.

Three runs off the over. Gayakwad back into the attack.

Three runs off the over. Poonam Yadav will bowl the 42nd over.

Gayakwad into the attack.

3/23 by Jhulan Goswami are the fourth best bowling figures in any World Cup final.

ENG : 168/6, 40.0 overs; Jhulan Goswami Scalps Third Wicket

Three runs, Goswami finishes with figures of 3 for 23. Memorable bowling from her, as she gets huge applause from an appreciative Lord’s crowd.

Just one run off the over. Goswami comes in for her last over.

Wicket maiden from Jhulan, would you believe that! Gayakwad to bowl her sixth over.

Goswami to Sciver, out Lbw!! Sciver is asking for a review but the third umpire calls the dismissal. Sciver is walking back. Jhulan is in the midst of the spell of her lifetime here. England have lost their sixth wicket. Sciver lbw b Goswami 51(68). Jenny Gunn walks in to bat.

Shikha Pandey to Brunt, FOUR, excellend on-drive from Brunt beating the fielder and finding the fence for a much needed boundary. Seven off the over, Goswami is back into the attack.

Shikha Pandey to Sciver, 1 run, Pandey begins a fresh spell and is driven towards long-on for a single which raises Sciver’s fifty. Excellent innings from Natalie Sciver.

Just two runs off the over. Jhulan Goswami has put the lid on England here. Shikha Pandey will bowl the next over.

Batting powerplay is in effect.

ENG : 155/5, 35.0 overs; Jhulan Goswami Scalps Two As India Back In Hunt

Four off the over. Goswami to bowl her eight over.

Five off the over. Harmanpreet Kaur is back into the attack.

Two runs and two wickets off the over. Poonam Yadav will bowl the next over.

Katherine Brunt, right handed bat, comes to the crease. 

Goswami to Fran Wilson, out Lbw!! Wilson is struck right before the stumps, and the legendary bowler has brought India right ahead. Golden duck for Wilson as half the England side is back into the hut. Fran Wilson lbw b Goswami 0(1)

Goswami to Taylor, out Caught by Sushma Verma!! Much needed break for India as Sarah Taylor edges the unlucky one. Taylor c Sushma Verma b Goswami 45(62). Fran Wilson is the new bat.

Four off the over, Goswami to bowl the next over.

Poonam Yadav is back into the attack.

PThree runs off a wide, seven off the over. England are slowly creeping back as the pair head to a century stand.

Goswami is back into the attack.

ENG : 133-3, 30.0 overs; England Fight Back With Sciver-Taylor Stand

England seem to be fighting back with this partnership. Five runs off the over.

Harmanpreet Kaur to Sciver, FOUR, paddled away for a much needed boundary. Deepti Sharma is the next bowler.

Four runs off the over. Harmanpreet Kaur is the next bowler.

Shikha Pandey to Sciver, FOUR, hit past the bowler and the fielder at mid-off and carried by a quick outfield. Seven runs off the over. Deepti Sharma into the attack.

Four runs off the over, England batsmen rotate strike on this one. Shikha Pandey is back into the attack.

Poonam Yadav is back into the attack.

ENG : 104/3, 25.0 overs; Runs Dry Up For England

Ten runs off the over.

Harmanpreet Kaur to Sciver, FOUR, down leg.  Sciver sinks, takes it right off the middle and brooms it very fine

Single, but there was a small mixup. It could have been something but both batsmen turned back after a couple of steps while trying to go for the second.

Three runs off the over, a single and a double. Harmanpreet Kaur into the attack.

Only three singles off the over. Poonam comes back for her fifth over.

Three runs off the over, the runs are drying up for the England batsmen. Harmanpreet Kaur, right arm medium fast will bowl the next bowler.

Five singles off the over, Deepti Sharma is the new bowler.

Poonam Yadav back into the attack.

ENG : 80/3, 20.0 overs; Knight Falls To Poonam Yadav

Six runs off Gayakwad’s over.

Five off the over. Gayakwad is back into the attack.

Poonam Yadav to Sciver, FOUR, shot in front of square off a full toss from Yadav. First boundary off Yadav.

Five off the over, Poonam Yadav is back for her third over.

Deepti Sharma to Sciver, FOUR, the new batswoman means business with a full shot dancing down the pitch.

Deepti Sharma into the attack.

One run and a wicket make it an excellent over from Poonam. She has figures of 2-0-3-2 right now!

Poonam Yadav to Knight, out Lbw!! Knight tried to sweep this one against the turn, and finds it on the pads. The Hawkeye gives a red on all three counts and Knight is on her way. This is a very important wicket for India.Knight lbw b Poonam Yadav 1(7). Natalie Sciver comes out to bat.

Poonam Yadav back into the attack.

Two singles to cap an excellent over, the pressure’s firmly on England.

Deepti Sharma is back into the attack.


ENG : 61/2, 15.0 overs; India remove both openers

Two runs and a wicket, this is a great over from Yadav.

Poonam Yadav to Beaumont, out Caught by Goswami!! Top edge off a full toss for a very soft ending for the England opener. Beaumont c Goswami b Poonam Yadav 23(37) [4s-5]. Heather Knight walks in to bat.

Seven off the over. Poonam Yadav, right-arm leg break, comes into the attack

Rajeshwari Gayakwad to Beaumont, FOUR, shot between cover and point on the backfoot by Beaumont, races to the boundary.

Two runs, a wide and a single off the over. Gayakwad is back into the attack.

Four runs and a wicket off the over. Deepti Sharma back into the attack.

Rajeshwari Gayakwad to Winfield, out Bowled!! Clean bowled that is. India get their first wicket after managing to keep up the pressure on the England batsmen. Winfield b Rajeshwari Gayakwad 24(35) [4s-4]. Sarah Taylor is the new bat.

Three runs off the over. Gayakwad will bowl the next over.

Deepti Sharma, right-arm medium, takes Goswami’s end.

ENG : 43/0, 10.0 overs; Both Openers Get Lifelines

Maiden over.

Rajeshwari Gayakwad to Beaumont, no run, dropped. Beaumont wanted to run it down and edged it. Keeper Sushma Verma could not keep it in her gloves.

Just one run, leg byes, off the over. Gayakwad will bowl the tenth over.

Goswami to Winfield, umpire gives her out lbw but the pair review. Ultraedge shows that the delivery would miss the stumps so Winfield is going to stay.

Goswami is back into the attack.

Rajeshwari Gayakwad to Winfield, FOUR, paddles the ball to the fine leg area.

Rajeshwari Gayakwad to Winfield, FOUR, big lbw appeal on this one but umpire thinks it hit the bat on its way to the fence.

Rajeshwari Gayakwad to Winfield, FOUR, driven past cover with exquisite timing and placement. Gayakwad getting the painful welcome.

Change of pace! Rajeshwari Gayakwad, left-arm orthodox into the attack.

Maiden over! Excellent work by Goswami just when the two openers were looking to settle in. The pressure is back on England.

Nine off the over, Goswami is back into the attack.

Shikha Pandey to Beaumont, FOUR, again! Driven past extra cover, this one looked even better than the last one. She looks dangerous for the day.

Shikha Pandey to Beaumont, FOUR, cover drive! A hard drive from Beaumont to being up 400 runs in ODI cricket.

Shikha Pandey comes in for her third over.

ENG : 21/0, 5.0 overs; England make solid start

Four runs off the over, incident free as Goswami struggles with the line but is lucky not to get hit to the boundaries.

Goswami to bowl the fifth over.

Two runs, a wide and a single off the over.

Shikha Pandey is starting her second over.

Just four off the over.

Goswami to Beaumont, FOUR, cut between cover and backwards point. Short ball it was, and well used.

Goswami back for her second over.

Shikha Pandey to Winfield, FOUR, this was a misfield at the outfield fielder Mandhana who just let it slip.

Shikha Pandey to Beaumont, FOUR, first four of the innings. Beautiful flick to midwicket.

One run off a sedate first over. Shikha Pandey will bowl the second over.

Winfield and Beaumont to open the innings. Winfield is on strike. Goswami will open the attack for the Indians.

Teams:

England Women (Playing XI): Lauren Winfield, Tammy Beaumont, Sarah Taylor(w), Heather Knight(c), Natalie Sciver, Fran Wilson, Katherine Brunt, Jenny Gunn, Laura Marsh, Anya Shrubsole, Alex Hartley

India Women (Playing XI): Smriti Mandhana, Punam Raut, Mithali Raj(c), Harmanpreet Kaur, Deepti Sharma, Veda Krishnamurthy, Sushma Verma(w), Jhulan Goswami, Shikha Pandey, Rajeshwari Gayakwad, Poonam Yadav

 

 

 

 

England win toss and elect to bat first.

India and England battle it out for glory at the Lord’s stadium, cricket’s meccah. India will be playing just their second ever finals of the World Cup, while England will be hoping to snatch a third crown. Both teams have done very well in the tournament, although England will be wary of the defeat they suffered at the hands of Mithali and co. in the opening match of the tournament.

Following is the scoreboard of the ICC Women's World Cup final between England and 
India at Lord's here on Sunday ( Source: IANS) :

England:

Lauren Winfield b Gayakwad 24

Tammy Beaumont c Goswami b Poonam Yadav 23

Sarah Taylor c Sushma Verma b Goswami 45

Heather Knight lbw b Poonam Yadav 1

Natalie Sciver lbw b Goswami 51

Fran Wilson lbw b Goswami 0

Katherine Brunt run out (Deepti Sharma) 34

Jenny Gunn not out 25

Laura Marsh not out 14

Extras 11 (w 7, nb 1, lb 3)

Total 228/7 (50 Overs)

Fall of wickets: 1-47 (Winfield, 11.1 overs), 2-60 (TT Beaumont, 14.3), 
3-63 (HC Knight, 16.1), 4-146 (Taylor, 32.4), 5-146 (Wilson, 32.5), 
6-164 (Sciver, 37.1), 7-196 (Brunt, 45.6).

Bowling:

Jhulan Goswami 10-3-23-3

Shikha Pandey 7-0-53-0

Rajeshwari Gayakwad 10-1-49-1

Deepti Sharma 9-0-39-0

Poonam Yadav 10-0-36-2

Harmanpreet Kaur 4-0-25-0

India:

Punam Raut lbw b Anya Shrubsole 86

Smriti Mandhana b A Shrubsole 0

Mithali Raj run out (Natalie Sciver/S Taylor) 17

Harmanpreet Kaur c Tammy Beaumont b Alex Hartley 51

Veda Krishnamurthy c Natalie Sciver b Shrubsole 35

Sushma Verma b Alex Hartley 0

Deepti Sharma c Sciver b Shrubsole 14

Jhulan Goswami b Shrubsole 0

Shikha Pandey run out (Shrubsole/Taylor) 4

Poonam Yadav not out 1

Rajeshwari Gayakwad b Shrubsole 0

Extras 11 (b 0, lb 3, w 7, nb 1, p 0)

Total 219 (10 wkts, 48.4 Ov)

Fall of Wickets: 5-1 (Smriti Mandhana, 1.4 overs), 43-2 (Mithali Raj, 12.1), 
138-3 (Harmanpreet Kaur, 33.3), 191-4 (Punam Raut, 42.5), 196-5 (Sushma Verma, 43.3),
200-6 (Veda Krishnamurthy, 44.4), 201-7 (Jhulan Goswami, 44.6), 
218-8 (Shikha Pandey, 47.3), 218-9 (Deepti Sharma, 48.1), 
219-10 (Rajeshwari Gayakwad, 48.4)

title.rendered: Chelsea Sign Real Madrid’s Alvaro Morata In £70 Million Deal

content.rendered:
Chelsea signed the most expensive player in their history by netting Alvaro Morata from the La Liga giants Real Madrid for a net fee of £70 million. This is one of the biggest signings as we head to the end of the transfer season, and is Chelsea’s biggest signing ever since getting Fernando Torres from Liverpool for £50 million. Morata scored 20 goals off 49 apperances in the last season for La Liga and European champions Real Madrid, but was destined to move out as he often found himself out of favour with coach Zinedine Zidane who preferred French international Karim Benzema. After news broke of the Premier League adventure in store for Morara, especially in his Chelsea’s famous blue colours, Morata was seen snapping pictures with teammates saying their farewell and wishing him luck. However, reports suggest that, shockingly, Benzema refused to say farewell to Morata in an indication of the bad blood between the two players who often had to compete for the coach’s attention and a spot in the starting lineup.

Morata was one of the few home grown talents in the Real Madrid side. The Spain international was born and raised in Madrid, and progressed through the Real academy and the B team before he made his debut for the Real side in 2010. He shifted base to Juventus in 2014, where he won the Italian Serie A with Juventus twice. His sizzling performances caused his home team to initiate a buy-back for a figure of £27 million in 2016. His most recent stay at Benabeu has not been so good though, even though the side’s fortunes have gotten better and better with each season. Morata wrote a lengthy farewell on Twitter, stating that some will not understand his decision to bid his club goodbye for the second time, but that it was his decision and a new phase of his career. He also thanked the coaching staff, teammates and fans at the club for the last two years.

Chelsea coach Antonio Conte has worked with Morata briefly at Juventus, and will be hoping to add some different flavour in his front lines with his addition.

This is one of the biggest signings as we head to the end of the transfer season, and is Chelsea’s biggest signing ever since getting Fernando Torres from Liverpool […]

title.rendered: Mithali Raj says it will be revolution if Indian team wins the ICC Women’s World Cup 2017

content.rendered:
Indian captain sounded confident ahead of the final against England of the ICC Women’s World Cup here in England today, repeating the same words she said when she was departing for the tournament in Mumbai – winning the World Cup would be a revolution. If she meant one on the scale of the 1983 victory of the men’s team that put cricket right there in the national imagination and was arguably the beginning of India’s honeymoon with the game of cricket, she did not really say. However, India’s run in the tournament, where they got the better of England in the first game, South Africa and finally the Australian team in the last match. The victory against Australia means that the girls are peaking at just the right time in the tournament, with captain Mithali Raj on a roll as she always is. The Indian captain expressed the desire to take the World Cup trophy home, the first time for the Indian women’s team, and added that winning the World Cup would be just the shot in the arm that women’s cricket needs in India, giving impetus to all the young girls out there who want to take up and excel at the sport.

Raj also added that it would give a platform for the team to showcase the kind of cricket they have been playing for about two years now. While it is true that the team has peaked, England have also done well for themselves after losing their opening game to India and it is going to somewhat hard to play the team on their home ground, given the extra motivation that comes from crowd support. Besides, England have won the tournament as recently as 2009 and there are still players who were present when England triumphed the world last. On the other hand, the Indians will be under a lot of pressure given that this is there second appearance in the finals of the World Cup, and also knowing that an entire nation will be watching how well they do come Sunday.

title.rendered: BCCI announces cash price for Indian Women’s Cricket Team ahead of the finals

content.rendered:
The Board of Cricket Control in India (BCCI) have announced a cash award of 50 lakh rupees to each player of Indian Women’s Cricket Team for their performance on the eve of finals of the Women’s World Cup against England at the Lord’s in London. BCCI has also announced Rs 25 lakh each for the support staff of the team.

Aiming for their maiden Women’s World Cup crown, India rode on all-rounder Harmanpreet Kaur’s breezy 115-ball unbeaten 171 to knock Australia out by 36 runs in the semi-final at Derby on Thursday.

Announcing the cash awards the board’s acting Secretary Amitabh Choudhary said: “The BCCI would like to announce a cash prize of Rs 50 lakh to each member of the squad and Rs 25 lakh to each member of the support staff. We wish them the best as they prepare for their biggest match tomorrow at the Lord’s Cricket Ground.”

Hailing the performance of the side, BCCI’s Committee of Administrators (CoA) chief Vinod Rai said: “I would like to congratulate the Indian women’s cricket team for their exemplary show in the ICC Women’s World Cup.”

“The team has shown tremendous character and the girls have raised the bar with each passing game under the able leadership of Mithali Raj. The women’s World Cup has been widely followed across India and this team’s spirit and performance on the field has won admirers all over the world. I am sure this team has inspired the next generation of cricketers and many more girls will take up the sport in the years to come.”

Acting President C.K. Khanna said: “The BCCI acknowledges the performance of the Indian women’s cricket team that has qualified for the final of the ICC Women’s World Cup 2017.”

“The team has a good blend of young talent and experienced campaigners in captain Mithali Raj and Jhulan Goswami. The all-round performance was on display in the semi-final against Australia women, who have won the World Cup six times. The fearless batting of Harmanpreet Kaur mirrors the team’s approach under pressure,” Khanna added.

This is the Indian women’s team’s second entry in a World Cup final, having lost to Australia in their first attempt in 2005 at Centurion.

title.rendered: Harmanpreet Outburst Reduces Deepti Sharma To Tears After Mixup On Crease

content.rendered:
India stunned six time champions Australia yesterday with a stirring batting performance, anchored by the unlikely Harmanpreet Kaur who scored un unbeaten 171 to help India reach 281 in 42 overs after rain shortened the match. Harmanpreet Kaur’s innings was the fourth-highest individual score in women’s ODI cricket, and has drawn comparisons with Kapil Dev’s 175 against Zimbabwe in 1983 that arguably won India the title by keeping them in the tournament. Kaur’s innings was peppered with 20 fours and 7 sixes, and she probably would have scored a double century were it not for the rain interrupting. The storied innings which will certainly be remembered as a milestone in the history of women’s cricket in India

The storied innings which will certainly be remembered as a milestone in the history of women’s cricket in India were not without bumps. After her stand with Mithali Raj, Kaur then got together with Deepti Sharma (who scored 188 against South Africa earlier this year) to put together a stand of 137 runs. In the 36th over, Harmanpreet decided to go for an almost suicidal double and her partner Deepti hesitated for the obvious reasons. Both batters went back and got to their crease in time, though that was enough for Kaur to lose her cool at Sharma in a very public outburst.

Is it @ImHarmanpreet or @imVkohli ?
Harmanpreet Kaur#ICCWomensWorldCup2017 #IndvAus pic.twitter.com/5ZIiZzF3QU

— #VicY-786 (@IamVicySinha) July 20, 2017

Harmanpreet Kaur celebrated her hundred by throwing her helmet because Sharma almost ran her out. SHE'S DESTROYING EVERYTHING

— Jarrod Kimber (@ajarrodkimber) July 20, 2017

The dressing-down reduced Deepti Sharma to tears right on the pitch. Kaur apparently apologised later for her behaviour to Deepti, and went on to say “I didn’t get a chance to bat in the whole tournament, wanted to utilise that opportunity. Whatever I was thinking, I utilised. The plan was to watch the ball and hitting the ball. It was the heat of the moment (Deepti Sharma incident), I said sorry to her. We’re fine now.” Given that it was her brilliant knock that put India in the finals of the World Cup and defeat the Aussies who thrashed them convincingly in the group stages, we would say most fans as well as Deepti Sharma must have forgiven for the vulnerable moment.

title.rendered: India v/s Sri Lanka President 11 2017: Jadeja Claims Three As President’s XI Struggle at 165/7

content.rendered:
The two-day warm match between Indian and Sri Lanka President’s XI began in Colombo today ahead of the three test series against Sri Lanka. The Sri Lanka President’s XI chose to bat, and was tottering at 165/7 in 50 overs at the time of writing. Once at 138/1 and looking to post a decent score, the President’s XI were rocked by Ravindra Jadeja who spun his way to three wickets and a run out in which he was heavily involved. The Jadeja theatrics have bent the match in the visitor’s favour, and they will be hoping to get them all out before the day ends today.

The practice match also marks the return of opener Rohit Sharma to Test cricket. His last test match was against New Zealand during last year’s home season, and he sat out the home series against England, Bangladesh and Australia. He then underwent a thigh surgery in London and made a comeback during the Indian Premier League this year, where he led his team Mumbai Indians to victory in the tournament. He was also the Golden Bat during the Champions Trophy in England, scoring in excess of 300 runs during the four matches of the tournament. He had been rested during the ODI series against Windies keeping in mind the heavy cricket schedule the team has for this season, but he will look to prove his chops in the warm up match keeping in mind the upcoming Tests.

Also making comebacks are opener KL Rahul and pacer Mohammad Shami. KL Rahul will be eager to make an impression, as India is not short on openers with Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan both fit to play again. The slow tracks in Sri Lanka mean that India would probably go with a three man spin attack featuring Kuldeep Yadav, Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja. With his all-around skills on display today at the practice match, he is a shoo-in to the squad.

The first of the three Tests will be played at Galle starting July 26.

title.rendered: ICC Women’s World Cup 2017: Apart from Harmanpreet’s brilliance, Jhulan Gowami and Veda Krishnamurthy too gave wonderful moments

content.rendered:
Indian batsman Harmanpreet Kaur completely outplayed Australia in the semi finals of the ICC Women’s World Cup 2017 with her brilliant innings of 171-runs off just 115-balls to advance India to the finals of the tournament after India elected to bat first against six-time champion Australia after winning the toss. Harmanpreet’s inning helped India to put a target of 282-runs in the 42-overs a side affair.

But after Harmanpreet’s storm when India came out in the middle to defend the target, seasoned bowler Jhulan Goswami did something which had the capacity to overshadow Harmanpreet’s brilliance. The 34-year old pacer bowled an unplayable delivery to remove Australian legend and captain Meg Lanning, the ball pitched on off, seaming away on a very small angel and disbanded the wickets which eventually put India over the top in the game. The sight was probably the best moment of the tournament.

Watch the ball of the tournament here:

it's not often you see this – the number one ranked batter #MegLanning out for a duck! #AUSvIND #WWC17

WATCH: https://t.co/obWnfodPGk pic.twitter.com/OI4I3IiNwC

— ICC (@ICC) July 20, 2017

While the match saw another best moment of the tournament when Indian captain Mithali Raj and Veda Krishnamurthy starts performing a happy dance in the middle watching Harmanpreet’s brutality.

That was indeed a most epic match in the history of Indian women cricket history. India will now play host England in the semi finals at Lord’s. Lord’s has a great significance in the India cricket history. India won its first world cup at the same stadium under Kapil Dev in 1983. The fifteen-year-old Natwest series final was also played at the same stadium which was again one of the most memorable matches for India

Harmanpreet’s inning helped India to put […]

title.rendered: ICC Women’s World Cup 2017: India reaches finals as Harmanpreet Kaur squalls over Australia

content.rendered:
It was completely Harmanpreet Kaur’s show as India reaches the finals of the ICC Women’s World Cup for the second time by defeating six-times champions Australia in the second semi final of the tournament. Harmanpreet completely thrashed Australia by scoring over 60% of runs of entire Indian innings singlehandedly. Harmanpreet scored 171-runs off just 115-balls with the fabulous strike-rate of 148.70 hitting a total 7-sixes 20-fours in her inning. Harmanpreet reached her hundred in 90-balls but then Harmanpreet awakened the monster in her and scored next 71-runs in just 25-deliveries. Out of India’s 139-runs in the last 11-overs of the innings, 108-runs came out of Harmanpreet’s bat.

 

Earlier India won the toss and elected to bat first, lost Smriti Mandhana int he very first over, in the tenth over of the 42-overs India lost its second opener too when the score was just 35-runs. Then captain Mithali Raj and Harmanpreet made efforts to build the innings from there, after the end of 20 overs – nearly the halfway mark, India had only 70-runs on the scoreboard, both Raj and Harmanpreet were scoring at the strike rate of around 50-runs. Captain Mithali went back to the pavilion by the end of the 25th over, but after her wicket, the next batsman 19-year old Deepti Sharma, who was playing against the mighty Australia for the second-time only stuck on the crease for 137-runs with Harmanpreet.

Meanwhile, in the pressurising chase, Australian lost three early wickets at just 26-runs, However, by the end of their innings in 41st over Australia made 245-runs but they were never in the game.

India will now play the final against host England on Sunday at Lord’s, a stadium where India won its first ever ICC World Cup in 1983. Indian women have reached the finals of the tournament for the first time after 12-years and only for the second time in the history of the ICC Women’s World Cup. While England’s only defeat in the entire tournament came against India in the first match.

title.rendered: ICC Women’s World Cup 2017: India to take on six time champion Australia in semi finals

content.rendered:
Indian Women Cricket Team will take on Australia in the semi-final of the ICC Women’s World Cup 2017 in Derby on Thursday. India has reached the semi final of the tournament for the first time after 12-years. Last time when Indian team played the semifinal in 2005 in South Africa, they went on to play their first ever world cup final against the same team Australia to finish as 1st runner-up. This is overall the fourth semifinal for India in ICC World Cup history.

Australia has been the most dominating team in the cricket history whether it is men’s cricket or women’s cricket, they always have a giant record in all of them. Australian women have won 6-titles out of the previous 10 occasions and reached the final eight times. They have never gone out of the world cup without reaching the semi finals.

Though Indian team has played well throughout the tournament, the matter to worry for India is that they Australia brutally assassin them in the group match. India won five out the seven of their group matches and came back very strong in the do and die game against New Zealand in the last group match. Indian bowlers bowled out the whole team of New Zealand and Pakistan inside 80-runs. While India will look to improve their batting performance if they want to win the crucial game against giant Australia, India will need to give their best today in all the departments. Indian captain Mithali Raj is the leading run-scorer for India in the tournament with 356-runs in seven matches
